metadata.label: Repro Title

metadata.value: View of pages from Shakespeare's Romeo and Juliet. Dating to 1949, this work is a facsimile of the second quarto of Romeo and Juliet, which was published by T. Creede of London in 1599. This makes the original one of the earliest examples of Shakespearean literature, as it dates to well within the author's own lifetime. Also belonging to Edinburgh university (see shelfmark De.3.73 for images), it was donated between 1626 and 1636 by former student William Drummond, making it part of the university's first literature collection. Sources: http://www.shakespeare-online.com/playanalysis/romeoplayhistory.html (accessed 24/09/14). http://www.ed.ac.uk/schools-departments/information-services/library-museum-gallery/crc/collections/special-collections/rare-books-and-manuscripts/rare-books-directory-section/william-drummond (accessed 24/09/14). http://www.quartos.org/index.html (accessed 24/09/14).
